titles.title: Equal Access to Preseparation Counseling Act
To amend title 10, United States Code, to require preseparation counseling for members of the reserve components upon their retirement or separation from service.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Military Personnel.

bill.summary: 5/11/2010--Introduced. Equal Access to Preseparation Counseling Act - Requires the Secretary of the military department concerned to provide individual preseparation counseling for each member of the reserves whose discharge or release from service is anticipated as of a specific date. (Under current law, such counseling must be provided only to a member of the Armed Forces whose discharge or release from active duty is anticipated as of a specific date.)
